p: Subjects are cognitive attributes defined by position of individuals in a social system, such as medicinal value chain. Practices, discourses, policies and actions define subjects around which actors assert their agenda and protect their interests in face of social and environmental change [ 4]. Discourses may for example legitimise particular knowledge and subjectivities. The discourses with less formal local institutions are critical vehicles for contestation within and between institutions and interactions between localites and larger scale institutions [ 25].
